title.narrative: Addressing differential needs of drought affected women and girls and providing lifesaving services on Gender Based Violence in Afar Region

description.narrative:
In order to mitigate the undesired outcomes of drought and flood in escalating Gender Based Violence among internally displaced persons and host communities in Dubit, Asayita and Mille woredas in Afar region UNFPA has been supporting GBV in Emergency Programming by providing supplies for GBV response services in Afar region. UNFPA has been collaborating on this with partners namely the Afar Regional Bureau of Women and Children Affairs and the Women and Children Affairs Offices in the three woredas. UNFPA and partners, through this project, are seeking to address the undesired outcomes related to prevailing levels of various forms of GBV among El Nino affected communities in Dubit, Asayita and Mille woredas in Afar region.
The design of the project is based on pieces of evidences obtained from representatives of the affected population including staff of the woreda and zonal Women and Children Affairs Offices IDP community leaders, women and adolescents girls – during the joint inter-agency protection field mission and agency specific rapid gender analysis assessment.
Some of the main project interventions include enhancing the capacity of 3 host community health centers with post-rape treatment medical supplies offering psychosocial support to vulnerable women and girls through women friendly spaces and 3000 culturally appropriate dignity kits to address the protection and menstrual hygiene needs of women of reproductive age. This will be complemented with advocacy messages and information on GBV for the prevention of Gender Based Violence, and strengthening coordination among multi-sectoral service providers, including the establishment of government led confidential GBV Information Management System in the three selected woredas. The current drought and flood situations in the project areas have increased the number of vulnerable women and girls requiring immediate humanitarian assistance and lifesaving interventions. Through implementation of this project, 71,108 women and girls will be targeted to address their specific vulnerability while a total of 35,926 men and boys will also benefit including being active member of the GBV watch group.
